titleStmt.title: or even scientific values
a machine readable transcription
titleStmt.author: Walt Whitman
titleStmt.sponsor: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities, University of Nebraska-Lincoln
titleStmt.funder: The National Endowment for the Humanities

address.addrLine: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

availability.p: The text of the original document is in the public domain. Subject to certain exceptions, public domain works may be freely copied or used in the creation of derivative works without permission, or authorization, of the former copyright owners.

The text encoding was created and/or prepared by the Walt Whitman Archive and is governed by a Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License (CC BY 4.0). Permission to reproduce the graphic images of the original item has been granted by the owners of the original for this publication only.

note.p: This manuscript fragment is a partial draft of "George Fox (and Shakspere.)", the final section of "Notes (such as they are) founded on Elias Hicks," an essay first published in (1888) and later reprinted in Complete Prose Works (1892).

bibl.author: Whitman, Walt
bibl.title: "…or even scientific values, having done their office…," manuscript fragment, undated, 1p
bibl.orgName: The Walt Whitman Collection, Harry Ransom Humanities Research Center, The University of Texas at Austin
bibl.note: Transcribed from digital images of the original.

body.p: or‸evenscientific values, having done their office to the human identityand ministered, all they 'con to its devel-opmentor comfort—thinesull shall all cause——shall remaining thespiritual zealotment& value, in itsthese adjuncts morals & religions‸—The spiritual sentiment. Most neglected of all in our age, of all the elements‸near attributes of humanity easily be deluded‸covered with crust, deluded, &abused, rejected, yet the only certain source of what all are c incessantly seeking yet non find—I in it I clear for myself clearly see the first heights above and‸the last the heighest height of art,of literature & ‸the purposeof life itself—I say whoever labors here con-
